page.title: 11STOKE VILLAGE HALL
page.content: {Stoke Village Hall}was completed in 1980 at a cost of Â£50,000. Much of this was raised by the villagers themselves with the remainder coming from Council grants and contributions. The hall is situated opposite the Chapel and is conveniently sited for most part of the village _ an essential factor in community life. The Hall has one main room capable of holding 120 people, a large room with kitchen facilities, a chair store and cloakrooms. The activities and functions held in lthe hall are many and range from a playgroup for 3_5 yr olds to activities such as Majorettes, Youth Drama, O.A.P. Club and the W.I..weekend functions often include wedding receptions and dances. All local organisations pay reduced rates for booking, while others pay on a sliding scale.
